title: Question about displaying flash content on Firefox
content:
Hello. I have a following question:

Since Adobe is dropping the flashplayer plugin and the browser won't be supporting showing of the flash pages then how can view them? Take a notice that many websites (including online games) are made in flash, so it's not good to leave firefox without any support for this technology.

My idea (and a good alternative idea for the plugins) is that firefox should have a build-in flash support that would replace the need of downloading any flash plugins (especially unsupported), with could give a privacy risk for the users

title: Úprava kontextové nabídky
content:
Dobrý den,

chtěl bych se zeptat, zda jde nějakým způsobem upravit kontextová nabídka, která se zobrazí při stisknutí pravého tlačítka myši. (Podobně jako lze upravovat tuto kontextovou nabídku ve Windows.) Jde mi o to, že bych si tam rád přidal položku - stejně jako se po označení textu objeví možnost vyhledat "označený text" pomocí Google, hodilo by se mi stejná možnost pro mapy.cz. Děkuji za odpověď.
creator: petrkratochvil91

title: SOLVED: restore deleted bookmark folder MacOs Apple - nov 2020
content:
Hello firefox,

I accidentally deleted an important bookmark-folder, and it took some time to find how to restore them. This may help others too:

I followed this: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1031905, but is for Windows.

On Apple: cmd + shift + b

Select the 'import export' button,

Make backup: export to HTML

select 'restore'

Select the right date, and ready !

Cheers!

Pla

creator: olgerd

title: Right-click "Fill password" option shows even when Firefox Password Manager is disabled *and* LastPass istalled
content:
A small issue but an annoying one:

I have my options set not to save logins or ask to fill passwords, and have no such data saved in Firefox. I use LastPass for all of this, and its Firefox extension is working pretty well. The issue is that any time I right-click in a password field to get the LastPass options, there in the menu above them, the very first item, is Firefox's own "Fill password", which of course does nothing because I have saved nothing for it to use.

I used to click on this regularly by mistake. After long use I've finally developed the reflex to ignore it and go to the bottom of that list where the LastPass commands are, but it should not be appearing at all. First, because I've already set the options to say I do not want to use the password manager, and second, because there is another password manager in place, and Firefox should only ever use one at a time to prevent conflicts.

If there's anything I can do to fix this, I'd love to know about it, but I suspect it has to be a change request, and I can't find out from this site how to submit those. Please advise.
creator: fastauntie1
